current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To establish the Sangre de Cristo National Historical
		  Park, and for other purposes.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

committee-name.#text:
Committee on Energy and Natural
			 Resources

short-title.#text:
Sangre de Cristo National
			 Historical Park Establishment Act

text.#text:
This Act may be cited as
			 the

The purpose of this Act is to establish the
			 Sangre de Cristo National Historical Park—

to help preserve,
			 protect, and interpret the nationally significant historical and cultural
			 resources of the Sangre de Cristo Mountain Range-San Luis Valley region of
			 southern Colorado for the benefit and inspiration of future generations;

to educate the
			 public about—

nationally
			 significant sites and districts that convey the history of the northern
			 migrations and the other migrations of diverse peoples that settled in the
			 Sangre de Cristo Mountain Range-San Luis Valley region;

the exploration
			 and development of the region under Spanish rule from 1598 through 1821;

the post-1848
			 settlement history of the area under United States jurisdiction, and the
			 creation of the State of Colorado; and

the rich and
			 distinctive folklore, religions, and languages of the cultures in the area
			 today; and

to support and
			 enhance the network of partners, including the State and local governments,
			 private entities, and nonprofit entities, that will engage in the protection,
			 improvement, management, and operation of key resources and facilities in the
			 Park and throughout the National Heritage Area.
In this Act:

header.#text:
Establishment of
			 Sangre de Cristo National Historical Park

term.#text:
Sangre de Cristo National
			 Historical Park

text.#text:
Subject
			 to valid and existing rights, there is established in the State a unit of the
			 National Park System to be known as the

Subject
			 to valid existing rights, the Park shall be comprised of the following cultural
			 and historical sites and byways within the Sangre de Cristo Mountain Range-San
			 Luis Valley region of southern Colorado:

The Sangre de
			 Cristo Heritage Center, San Luis, Costilla County.

The Sociedad
			 Proteccion Mutua de Trabajadores Unidos building, Antonito, Conejos
			 County.

The Fort Garland
			 Museum, Fort Garland, Costilla County.

The Denver &
			 Rio Grande Antonito Depot, Antonito, Conejos County.

The Los Caminos
			 Antiguos Scenic and Historic Byway.

Dario Gallegos
			 House, San Luis, Costilla County.

Trujillo
			 Homesteads, Alamosa County.

Pike’s Stockade,
			 Conejos County.

The portions of
			 the Old Spanish National Historic Trail located in the areas of Alamosa,
			 Conejos, Costilla, Rio Grande, and Saguache counties where the trail crosses
			 federally owned land.

An additional site may not be added to the Park
			 unless—
the

notification of
			 the proposed addition of the site has been submitted to—
